bwwExcerpt: Skillfully directed by Jeff Calhoun, Bonnie & Clyde doesn’t glamorize its subjects, as Arthur Penn’s 1967 film was accused of doing, but it does sentimentalize them; they are introduced to us as children, dreaming of fame, and never grow far beyond that. No matter how many innocent people they kill, this musical’s Bonnie and Clyde remain—like the show itself—not great, but not that bad.

keyPhrases.quote: No matter how many innocent people they kill, this musical's Bonnie and Clyde remain—like the show itself—not great, but not that bad.
